title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text:
A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.
$$y<2x-1$$
$$0<2	imes0-1$$
$$0<-1$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is not a solution to $$y<2x-1$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the left side of the line, we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y \leq \frac{-1}{2} x+4$$ on the same grid.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text:
A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.
$$y \leq  rac{-1}{2} x+4$$
$$0 \leq 0 rac{-1}{2}+4$$
$$0 \leq 4$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is a solution to $$y \leq \frac{-1}{2} x+4$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the left side of the line $$y=\frac{-1}{2} x+4$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
